Background (extended) In a worldwide assessment, marine birds were found to face three major threats: i) predation by invasive alien species, ii) by-catch in fisheries and iii) climate change / severe weather, with by-catch having the greatest average impact (Dias et al.

u_shaped_ranking.core_sentence: change and ocean acidification.
u_shaped_ranking.context_window: Our vision is a clean, healthy and biologically diverse North-East Atlantic Ocean, which is productive, used sustainably and resilient to climate change and ocean acidification.

u_shaped_ranking.context_window: Knowledge Gaps (brief) Despite various legal obligations for the monitoring of by-catch of protected, endangered and threatened species (including marine birds) in fisheries, there is a long-lasting and persisting data deficiency for most species and from most parts of the OSPAR Maritime Area.
